summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) minor work request form for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York (NYM). It documents a request to repair two DVR failures in the Lieutenant's Office, with work authorized on July 19, 2019, and completed on August 26, 2019.

events.title: DVR Repair Work Order Authorization
events.description: A work order is authorized to repair two DVR failures in the Lieutenant's Office at the MCC New York facility.

events.title: DVR Repair Work Completed
events.description: The repair work for the two DVR failures in the Lieutenant's Office is recorded as completed.

locations: Work Location: SIS Corn Tech / SIS Corn Test
keyFacts: This is a routine facility maintenance work order from the Federal Bureau of Prisons.
The work order is for repairing DVR (Digital Video Recorder) failures, which are typically used for security camera systems.
The work was performed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
The work was authorized on July 19, 2019, and completed on August 26, 2019.
The specific location of the repair was the Lieutenant's Office, an administrative area within the facility.
